title: Business News: Corporate Watch
text:
Earnings Charge

Union Pacific Corp. will record a charge of roughly $278 million in its fourth-quarter results as the company adjusts plans for its Brazos rail-yard project.

The Omaha, Neb., railroad company began construction on the yard in Robertson County, Texas, three years ago. It was originally intended to be a classification yard, a site where railcars are sorted by destination and assembled into trains. Instead, Union Pacific will now use the site for block-swapping activities.

Block swapping involves transferring a linked set of railcars between trains without sorting individual cars. Completing the Brazos project as a classification yard would have required additional investment, Union Pacific said on Friday.

The company added that newly created capacity at existing facilities will be enough to handle Union Pacific's planned southern-region growth without using the Brazos site as a classification yard.

Union Pacific also provided preliminary results for its fourth quarter. It said it expects to report operating revenue of roughly $5.1 billion, operating expenses of roughly $3.1 billion and operating income of about $2 billion.

-- Matt Grossman

BED BATH & BEYOND

Retailer Speeds Up

Stock-Buyback Pact

Bed Bath & Beyond Inc. said it signed an additional $150 million accelerated share-repurchase agreement with JPMorgan Chase Bank as part of the retailer's $825 million stock-buyback program.

Bed Bath & Beyond, which currently has about 121.2 million shares outstanding, said it expects to receive about 5 million shares under the accelerated repurchase.

The Union, N.J., company said on Friday that $450 million will remain available for stock buybacks after the accelerated repurchase.

Shares of Bed Bath & Beyond rose 1% on Friday to $18.94.

-- Colin Kellaher

BOOT BARN

Growth at Stores

Boosts Holiday Sales

Boot Barn Holdings Inc. reported better-than-expected sales for the holiday quarter, boosted by growth at its retail locations.

The western and work-related footwear, apparel and accessories retailer reported preliminary sales of $302.3 million for the third quarter ended Dec. 26, a 6.5% increase over the year-earlier period. Analysts surveyed by FactSet were expecting $297.2 million.

Boot Barn said comparable sales at its retail locations returned to positive growth, rising 1.9%, while e-commerce grew 16%. The company said it benefited from disciplined promotional activity and strong sales at full price. Total same-store sales are expected to increase 4.6%, the company said.

-- Kimberly Chin

SIERRA METALS

Mining Company

Weighs Sale, Merger

Sierra Metals Inc. said on Friday that it is considering strategic alternatives including a sale of the company, an asset sale or a merger.

The Canadian mining company said the strategic review has the support of the funds that are the company's two largest shareholders.

Sierra said it has brought in CIBC World Markets Inc. to assist in the process. The company closed Friday on the Toronto Stock Exchange with a market cap of roughly US$540 million.

-- Matt Grossman
